questions_and_answers.question: What does ComfyUI-Catcat do?
questions_and_answers.answer: ComfyUI-Catcat is an extension that enhances user experience by providing a visual indicator of execution processes during queueing prompts in a fun and engaging way, displaying random cat GIFs at the bottom left of the screen.
questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Catcat

questions_and_answers.question: Who is the idea credited to and who built ComfyUI-Catcat?
questions_and_answers.answer: The idea for ComfyUI-Catcat is credited to Hyacinth and it was built by Chenran.
questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Catcat

questions_and_answers.question: How do I install ComfyUI-Catcat?
questions_and_answers.answer: To install ComfyUI-Catcat, go to the ComfyUI/custom_nodes directory in the terminal, run 'git clone https://github.com/jw782cn/ComfyUI-Catcat.git', and then restart ComfyUI.
questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Catcat

questions_and_answers.question: How can I use ComfyUI-Catcat in my workflow?
questions_and_answers.answer: To use ComfyUI-Catcat, simply run your workflow and random cats will appear during renderings.
questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Catcat

questions_and_answers.question: How can I add more cat GIFs to ComfyUI-Catcat?
questions_and_answers.answer: To add more cat GIFs, place your GIFs into the 'web/images' directory of your project, update the 'gifFilenames' array in the 'cat.js' file with the relative path to your new GIFs, and save the changes.
questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Catcat

questions_and_answers.question: What updates were made to ComfyUI-Catcat on 03/08?
questions_and_answers.answer: The extension added drag-and-drop and resize features.
questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Catcat

questions_and_answers.question: What does the disclaimer of ComfyUI-Catcat state?
questions_and_answers.answer: The disclaimer states that ComfyUI-Catcat is designed for fun and does not guarantee proper functioning.
questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Catcat

questions_and_answers.question: Who provides the base for ComfyUI-Catcat?
questions_and_answers.answer: ComfyUI-Catcat is based on the ComfyUI framework, so credit is given to ComfyUI.
questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Catcat
